column4: Did anyone here succeed in installing the latest nvidia beta drivers in feisty? the resulting kernel module just doesn't load here ;( amd my card is only supported by the latest beta..
modprobe gives me this: FATAL: Error running install command for nvidia
yep.. did that.. and modprobe -l does show it
nope.. that only happens if you leave nvidia-kernel-common installed.. i removed that (including restricted drivers)
but indeed I did have the api mismatch error when i left the old kernel module installed and just blacklisted it
the nvidia-installer leaves a build-log ... any clues in there?
haven't checked.. I should maybe have a look ;) but the installer and module-linking went through smoothly (no errors)
err.. any idea where die nvidia installer leaves its logfile?

hmm.. I'll check it out later.. the current log there is the log from the last uninstall process which of course doesn't give me any clues.. and since i'm running X now i can't run the installer ;) thx anyway for pointing me to the logfile!
i'd uninstall the whole kaboodle... all packages from the repos. search through the installer-archive for the source and then see if module-assistant  does a better job
i've done the uninstalling part already ;) i guess with the installer archive you mean the .sh file, right?
okay.. good point.. I will do that, too if the logfile leaves no clues.. thx for your help
